newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia April house material prices rise 0.3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Australia April house material prices rise 0.3 pct.

text.p: Australian house building materials rose 0.3 percent in April from the previous month and were 1.3 percent higher than a year earlier, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said on Thursday.
Other building materials rose 0.2 percent in the month and were 1.0 percent higher than a year earlier.
The bureau said the increase in housing materials was mainly due to higher prices for plastic pipes and fittings, cupboards and fittings, plaster products and clay bricks, the bureau said.
The index has risen every month so far this calendar year.
Non-housing materials increased mainly due to higher prices for reinforcing steel bar, the bureau said.
"Plaster and plaster products and plastic pipes and fittings also contributed slightly to the increase," it said.
